_inspectorSnowReport.Report: 2026 is off to a great start! Back-to-back storms have delivered 5 feet of new snow to the mountain since January 1, including 16 inches since Wednesday. Coverage and conditions have greatly improved wherever you point your skis. Our recent storm has wrapped but youll find lots of packed powder and loose fluff on the hill today. Snowmaking is in progress please stay clear of all snow guns. 7 of our 8 lifts are now open for the season, including Summit Express. To reach Summit you must take the Sunrise chairlift; no access to Summit is available from Apex Express. Delays on some lifts and terrain are likely this morning as avalanche mitigation takes place. Do not duck ropes into closed terrain. Serious hazards exist beyond our rope lines and youll lose your pass for 30 days or more at all Ikon Pass resorts. Temperatures will range from the single digits to teens today under mostly sunny skies. Dress warm and have a fantastic Friday at Solitude!

_inspectorSnowReport.Alert: Know The Code, limit your speed, and stay in control while skiing and riding.
